content.description: Starts about 30' to the left of Power Trip. Pulls through 3 bolts on the vertical face (currently very dirty) to join Power Trip at about it's 5th or 6th bolt. From there, it looks to power straight up and out the roof (rather than following the obvious Power Trip line to the left). The climbing out the roof looks powerful and *hard* (didn't try it, but just from looking at it, seemed like solid 5.13 climbing)!
content.location: 30' to the left of Power Trip / Cobble Reality. There's currently a 6" loop of pink webbing fixed on the third bolt.

content.description:
A unique climb for sure. A "girdle Traverse" according to DK. Start on the far right side of the roof, scurry up the easy slab, then start the long trip out left, following the obvious crack weakness, often making more sidewards progress than vertical.  The crux is a fairly bouldery long reach straight left to a good pocket off a vertical shallow sidepull pocket. Once you get past this its more or less pretty great holds the rest of the way, though the feet suck so you have to decided whether to campus it or heel hook. Once you pull the final roof an easy slab  leads to the anchors.

I found it tough to rest anywhere as its pretty sustained. A little dirty but hopefully it will clean up with more traffic. Don't fall anywhere between bolts or you'll be "boinging" the juice out of your arms.

I personally found it quite stiff for the grade.
content.protection: All bolts. Well bolted. Currently equipped with steel permas on all bolts. Mandatory following on TR to clean if the permas aren't there.
content.location: Start on the far right side of the roof at same first bolt as "cobble reality" and then start climbing straight left.

climbs.name: Frigg
climbs.fa: Todd Parr; Bolted by Darren Knezek

content.description: Start on some easy cobbles, to a hard crux sequence to get up to the rail on Power Trip. From there, either continue straight up for the FA on an open project, or, if mortal, finish to the left on Power Trip instead.
content.protection: 10 bolts (the last six on the Power Trip roof currently have steel permas on them)
content.location: Start in the middle of the cave to the left of the slab that starts Power Trip. Climb through four bolts to join Power Trip at its sixth bolt, then continue left to Power Trip's anchors.

content.description:
Climb the very left side of the cliff on the edge of solid and somewhat chossy rock. Starts out steep and turns into a nice slab before turning into a runout scramble on gravel. The anchor (at least the one I found) is on a wall above the cliff. It has links but no proper lower-off.

Ps. I climbed this to help some guys get their gear back. They weren’t sure what it was. Looking in the book, judging by the difficulty it presented, I figured it was the Time Hannig line. Please let me know if I am mistaken.
content.location: The left bookend of the cliff.

content.description:
Start on the easy slab on the far right side of the wall. Clip the first bolt off the slab, then embark on steep cobble pulling till an obvious crux at bolt 3 to get established in the cobble crack. Use the crack(dirty hand jams) and other standard cobble jugs till you can mantle onto the top belay ledge to chains, or continue up and left past 2 more bolts of 5.9 to another set of chains. Beware of large amounts of loose rock on the ledge near the top.

Not reminiscent of separate reality in Yosemite.
content.location: Located on the right side of the wall, that enters a steep crack 4-5 bolts up.
